    • Method Detail

      • onLifeCycleEvent

        public void onLifeCycleEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                    java.lang.Object component,
                    ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: ActivityController.Interceptor
        Invoked every time a new event occurs on the provided activity/component. For instance, this is an ideal for logging application usage analytics.

        The framework ensures that this method will be invoked from the UI thread, hence the method implementation should last a very short time!

        Caution: if an exception is thrown during the method execution, the application will crash!

        Specified by:
        onLifeCycleEvent in interface ActivityController.Interceptor
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity on which a life cycle event occurs ; cannot be null
        component - the component on which the life cycle event occurs ; may be null
        event - the event that has just happened
        See Also:
        ActivityController#onLifeCycleEvent()
